If an idx was given, this returns the idx value of the                 command information list if the command was found (None otherwise). If no idx is                 given, this returns true if the command is found (False otherwise).

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
str|tuple{[}int{]}|bool|str|None

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

Defaults to None.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Command ‘+str(cmd)+’ does not exist.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} This command does not take a payload.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} This command requires a payload.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Command needs more than one argument in the payload. Use a tuple of values.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Payload must have ‘+str(sum(args))+’ bytes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Payload must have ‘+str(len(args))+’ integer items in the tuple.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Bytes in the payload are the wrong sizes. The sizes must be ‘+str(args)+’.’

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} The payload tuple must only contain int or bytes items.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} Payload is of incorrect type. It must be an int, bytes, or tuple of int/bytes.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Reads the remaining part of the variable\sphinxhyphen{}length binary packet. It first reads the standard         packet (prePacket+payload+checksum+ETX). Then it determines how long the binary packet is from the         payload of the standard POD packet and reads that many bytes. It then reads to ETX to get the         checksum+ETX.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prePacket}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes string containing the beginning of a POD packet: STX (1 byte)                 + command number (4 bytes)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{validateChecksum}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Set to True to validate the checksum. Set to False to                 skip validation. Defaults to True.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} An exception is raised if the checksum is invalid (only if validateChecksum=True).

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Variable\sphinxhyphen{}length binary POD packet.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Binary.PacketBinary}]{\sphinxcrossref{PacketBinary}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_CodeDecimalAsHex() (Morelia.Devices.PodDevice\_8229.Pod8229 static method)@\spxentry{\_CodeDecimalAsHex()}\spxextra{Morelia.Devices.PodDevice\_8229.Pod8229 static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Devices:Morelia.Devices.PodDevice_8229.Pod8229._CodeDecimalAsHex}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_CodeDecimalAsHex}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{val}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ int}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Builds an integer that equals the val argument when converted into hexadecimal.         All integers are converted to hexadecimal ASCII encoded bytes. Some commands         (i.e. 8229 \#140) need decimal ASCII encoded bytes; to do this, give the return         value of \_CodeDecimalAsHex() as the payload. Example: I want a number that is         equal to 16 in hex. 1*16\textasciicircum{}1 + 6*16\textasciicircum{}0 = 22. Calling \_CodeDecimalAsHex(16) will         return 22.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{val}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Unsigned integer number.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
integer that equals the val argument when converted into hexadecimal.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Devices:Morelia.Devices.PodDevice_8274D.Pod8274D.WriteRead}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{WriteRead}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{cmd}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{str\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{payload}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }bytes\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }tuple\DUrole{p,p}{{[}}int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }bytes\DUrole{p,p}{{]}}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{validateChecksum}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{bool}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ {\hyperref[\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet}]{\sphinxcrossref{Packet}}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Writes a command with optional payload to POD device, then reads (once) the device response.
8274D works differently compared to other devices as it is bluetooth based. Some commands require a re\sphinxhyphen{}read from the
Pod Device, in order to get the right payload back. Each Get and Set Command will generate a Procedure Complete (command 211) indicating a successful write/read.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cmd}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Command number.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{payload}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{|}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} None when there is no payload. If there                 is a payload, set to an integer value or a bytes string. Defaults to None.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{validateChecksum}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Set to True to validate the checksum. Set to False to skip                     validation. Defaults to True.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{POD packet beginning with STX and ending with ETX. This may                 be a standard packet, binary packet, or an unformatted packet (STX+something+ETX).}
\sphinxAtStartPar
There are some conditions for some commands. For example, if cmd is Local Scan, it returns Payload{[}1:7{]}
because that will be the bluetooth address that can be used to connect to the device.

\end{description}


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet}]{\sphinxcrossref{Packet}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} The ssGain must be 1 or 5; set ssGain to None if no\sphinxhyphen{}connect.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{payload}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} None when there is no payload. If there                 is a payload, set to an integer value, bytes string, or tuple. Defaults to None.

\end{itemize}

Container class that stores a binary4 command packet for a POD device. The format is     STX (1 byte) + command (4 bytes) + packet number (1 byte) + TTL (1 byte) +     CH0 (2 bytes) + CH1 (2 bytes) + CH2 (2 bytes) + checksum (2 bytes) + ETX (1 byte).

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Packet}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Container class that stores a binary5 command packet for a POD device. The format is     STX (1 byte) + command (4 bytes) + packet number (1 byte) + status (1 byte)     + channels (9 bytes) + AEXT0 (2 bytes) + AEXT1 (2 bytes) + ATTL1 (2 bytes)     + ATTL2 (2 bytes) + ATTL3 (2 bytes) + ATTL4 (2 bytes) + checksum (2 bytes)     + EXT (1 byte)
\index{\_ssGain (Morelia.Packets.Binary5.PacketBinary5 attribute)@\spxentry{\_ssGain}\spxextra{Morelia.Packets.Binary5.PacketBinary5 attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Binary5.PacketBinary5._ssGain}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_ssGain}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Dictionary with A, B, C, D keys and             second stage gain values (1, 5, or None).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dict{[}str,int|None{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Gets the number of bytes in the smallest possible binary4 packet;         STX (1 byte) + command (4 bytes) + packet number (1 byte) + status (1 byte)         + channels (9 bytes) + AEXT0 (2 bytes) + AEXT1 (2 bytes) + ATTL1 (2 bytes)         + ATTL2 (2 bytes) + ATTL3 (2 bytes) + ATTL4 (2 bytes) + checksum (2 bytes)         + EXT (1 byte)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer representing the minimum length of a binary5 POD packet.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Container class that stores a command packet for a POD device. The format is     STX (1 byte) + command number (4 bytes) + data (? bytes) + ETX (1 byte). This class     also has a collection of methods for creating and interpreting POD packets.

\index{IntToAsciiBytes() (Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet static method)@\spxentry{IntToAsciiBytes()}\spxextra{Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet.IntToAsciiBytes}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{IntToAsciiBytes}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{value}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{numChars}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converts an integer value into ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
First, it converts the integer value into a usable uppercase hexadecimal string. Then it converts         the ASCII code for each character into bytes. Lastly, it ensures that the final message is the         desired length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example: if value=2 and numBytes=4, the returned ASCII will show b’0002’, which is         ‘0x30 0x30 0x30 0x32’ in bytes. Uses the 2’s complement if the val is negative.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Integer value to be converted into ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{numChars}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number characters to be the length of the ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded message.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes that are ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded conversions of the value parameter.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{STX() (Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet static method)@\spxentry{STX()}\spxextra{Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet.STX}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{STX}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} The high\sphinxhyphen{}pass filter must be 0.5, 1, or 10 Hz. If the channel is DC, input 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{\_Filter\_TakeFuture() (Morelia.Stream.Collect.DataHose.Hose method)@\spxentry{\_Filter\_TakeFuture()}\spxextra{Morelia.Stream.Collect.DataHose.Hose method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Morelia.Stream.Collect:Morelia.Stream.Collect.DataHose.Hose._Filter_TakeFuture}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_Filter\_TakeFuture}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{i}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{data}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{list\DUrole{p,p}{{[}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{Morelia.Packets:Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet}]{\sphinxcrossref{Morelia.Packets.Packet.Packet}}}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None\DUrole{p,p}{{]}}}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{timestamps}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{list\DUrole{p,p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p,p}{{]}}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Replaces the data value at index i with the next Packet. If the index points         to the last value in the data list, the data will be replaced with the previous         Packet instead. If there are multiple currupted points in a row (data value is         None), then all points will be replaced with the same future Packet.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{i}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Index of corrupted data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

Opens a save file and starts saving data to it. The file is updated about every 1 sec.         After the POD device stops streaming data, the file will close.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{timeout\_sec}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Quit saving data if no new data is recieved                 after timeout\_sec time (in seconds). Defaults to 10.0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sleep}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Time duration in seconds to wait for the Bucket to                 collect more data before checking agian. Defaults to 0.25.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Setup\_PodDevices allows a user to set up and stream from any number of POD devices. The streamed     data is saved to a file.

\sphinxAtStartPar
REQUIRES FIRMWARE 1.0.2 OR HIGHER.
